harp module¶

class harp.MainWindow(app)¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtGui.QMainWindow

Class to provide the GUI end of HARP.

Extends the QMainWindow class (from mainwindow.py) generated by QT Designer

Allows the user to setup a paramater file in the first table and lets the user view the processing in the second tab.

QT Designer automatically uses mixed case for its class object names e.g radioButton. This format is not PEP8 but has not been changed.

Constructor: Checks the buttons which have been pressed and responds accordingly.

Parameters:

app (object) –

Variables:
  • modality (str) – Changes based on the modality chosen. Value should be either ‘MicroCT’ or ‘OPT’
  • stop (boolean) – If True HARP stops pre-processing steps. Wont let the user go process the recon
  • stop_pro_switch (int) – If value 1 HARP stops processes due to user pressing stop
  • count_in (int) – Count used for processing table. Initialized at 0
  • current_row (int) – Row for processing table. Initialized at 0
  • scan_folder (str) – Scan path. Initialized as ‘NA’ to indicate no data
  • recon_log_path (str) – Recon log path. Initialized as ‘NA’ to indicate no data
  • f_size_out_gb (str) – File size (in GB). Initialized as ‘’ to indicate no data
  • pixel_size (str) – Pixel size. Initialized as ‘’ to indicate no data
about_message()¶

Short description about what HARP is and its version

add_more()¶

When the add more button is pressed, just go back to the first tab

add_to_list()¶

This will set off all the processing scripts and shows the dialog box to keep track of progress

add_to_list_action()¶
autofill_pipe(suppress=False)¶

Performs a series of methods to automatically update parameters

Uses the methods in the autofill module.

Parameters:suppress (boolean) – True if suppression of popup dialog box warnings is required
Variables:crop_box_use (boolean) – True if a derived croping box is to be used

See also

autofill.opt_uCT_check(), autofill.get_name(), autofill.get_recon_log(), autofill.auto_file_out(), autofill.get_channels(), autofill.auto_get_derived(), autofill.auto_get_scan(), autofill.folder_size_approx()

change_opt_chn()¶
choose_channel_for_crop(event)¶

If the return button is pressed on a certain row of the opt list this recon will be used for the automatic crop

closeEvent(event)¶

Function for when the program has been closed down Function name has to be mixed case format as it is from qt Performs a loop through the item list and checks if any process still running

crop_call_back(box)¶

Method to get crop dimension text (used in getDimensions)

crop_switch()¶

Turns crop options on or off

Options enabled and disabled are based on the imaging modality and the current cropping option selected

delete_rows(event)¶

If the delete button is pressed on a certain row the recon is taken off the list to be processed

derive_on()¶

Enables options for derived crop. Used by the radio button: radioButtonDerived.

dragEnterEvent(event)¶

Handles drag section for drag and drop of folders.

Overrides dragEnterEvent method from the QMainWindow. Required for drag and drop.

Parameters:object (event) – qt drag event

See also

dropEvent()

dropEvent(event)¶

Handles drop section for drag and drop of folders.

Overrides dropEvent method from the QMainWindow. Resets the inputs and auto-fills in the relevant parameter information.

Requires dragEnterEvent method.

Parameters:event (object) – qt drop event

See also

reset_inputs(), autofill_pipe()

example_data()¶

TESTING PURPOSES ONLY: Loads in example data

get_OPT_only()¶

Updates parameters options to be OPT only and updates OPT specific autofill operations.

Used by radio button: radioButtonOPT. Updates instance variable modality.

Variables:modality (str) – Should be “OPT” or “MicroCT”. Sets to “OPT” here.

See also

autofill.get_recon_log(), autofill.get_channels(),

get_SPR_man()¶

Get the SPR file manually

get_dimensions()¶

Perform a z projection which allows user to crop based on z projection. Two important files used. crop.py and zproject.py zproject peforms the zprojection and displays the image. crop.py then gets the dimensions to perform the crop NOTE: The cropping is not actually done here

get_recon_man()¶

Get the recon folder manually.

Used by the push button: pushButtonCTRecon

get_scan_man()¶

Get the scan folder manually

get_uCT_only()¶

Updates parameters options to be uCT only and updates uCT specific autofill operations.

Used by radio button: radioButtonuCT. Updates instance variable modality.

Variables:modality (str) – Should be “OPT” or “MicroCT”. Sets to “MicroCT” here.

See also

autofill.get_recon_log(),

input_folder_changed(text)¶

When user changes the name of the folder manually This functions is deprecated as the the code almost always takes the input folder directly from the line edit box “lineEditInput” anyway.

Updates the instance variable input_folder when the line edit box lineEditInput text has changed

Parameters:text (str) – The text from lineEditInput after the text has been changed
Variables:input_folder (str) – input folder as text
kill_em_all()¶

Function to kill all processes

man_crop_off()¶

Disables boxes for cropping manually. Used by the radio buttons: radioButtonAuto, radioButtonUseOldCrop.

man_crop_on()¶

Enables boxes for cropping manually. Used by the radio button: radioButtonMan.

output_folder_changed(text)¶

When user changes the name of the folder manually This functions is deprecated as the the code almost always takes the input folder directly from the line edit box “lineEditOutput” anyway.

Updates the instance variable output_folder when the line edit box lineEditInput text has changed

Parameters:text (str) – The text from lineEditInput after the text has been changed
Variables:output_folder (str) – output folder as text
processing_slot(message)¶

This listens to the child process and displays any messages. It has records the start and stop time of the processing and starts a new thread after the processing has finished

reset_inputs()¶

Reset the parameter inputs to blank

reset_screen()¶

Reset screen back to default

resize_screen()¶

Resize screen for smaller monitors

run_crop(img_path)¶

Method to create Crop object (used in getDimensions)

scale_by_pixel_on()¶

Enables boxes for scaling by pixel

select_file_in()¶

Selects input folder manually and some parameters are auto-filled if possible

If the the input folder is defined the parameters are reset, the ui.lineEditInput is updated and the autofill_pipe() method is performed which updates various parameters.

See also

reset_inputs(), autofill_pipe()

select_file_out()¶

Selects output folder manually

Updates the line edit box ui.lineEditOutput

See also

choose_channel_for_crop(), delete_rows()

start_processing()¶

Starts a thread for processing after the user has pressed the ‘start button’ (GUI click only)

start_processing_thread()¶

starts a thread to perform all the processing in the background. The add function then listens to any messages the thread makes

start_z_thread()¶

starts a thread to perform all the processing in the background.

stop_processing()¶

Stop processing, kill the current process

tab_change()¶

Changes the tab view for the user.

On tab 0 (parameters) the qt KeyPressEvent is required for choosing the crop channel for OPT. On tab 1 (processing) the KeyPressEvent is used for deleting rows on the processing table.

They KeyPressEvent is therefore updated depending on what tab the user is on.

Also updates the OPT channels table each tab-change in-case anything has changed.

See also

choose_channel_for_crop(), delete_rows()

update_name()¶

Update the name of the file and folder if the user has changed the name in the “identification” section

Used by push button: pushButtonUpdate.

Updates the output name by setting the text directly and updates the “identification” section using the autofill.get_name function.

See also

autofill.get_name(),

user_guide()¶

Loads up pdf help file

For windows computers uses os.startfile. For linux requires Evince installed to view the pdf.

zproject_slot(message)¶

This listens to the child process and displays any messages. It has records the start and stop time of the processing and starts a new thread after the processing has finished

harp.main()¶
